Just down from the White House is the World War II Memorial, it was important for me to visit, pay my respects and pray for all who have served and their families.üá∫üá∏My grandfather John Chapela served in World War II, and his unit was sent to the front lines. His truck overturned and he was sent to a hospital for his injuries. The rest of his unit went forward into battle and no one survived. On Veterans Day and every day, it's important to remember our freedom is not free. Thank you to all our men and women who've served our nation. God bless America and God bless our veterans!

Home of the free, because of the brave.üá∫üá∏ Happy Veterans Day! I come from a big family that has served this country proudly. Both my grandfathers John Chapela and Jake Martinez, aunt Ann Lopez, 6 uncles Joe, Jake, Phillip and Ed Martinez, Albert Lopez-Ramirez and Stanley Dineyazzie and my cousin Joseph Martinez who is active in the Marines. I understand that we would not have the freedoms we have today without the sacrifices of all that have served and supported them. God bless our veterans, active duty service members, and their families. Thank you for your service! #VeteransDay2019 #Godblessourvets #freedomisntfree

Congratulations to New Mexico Medal of Honor recipient Hiroshi ‚ÄúHershey‚Äù Miyamura, born and raised in my hometown of Gallup, NM.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôve tried to live my life by the words, ‚ÄòAlways believe in yourself, God and country,‚Äô ‚Äù Miyamura said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud to join so many veterans who epitomize this philosophy and to be a part of Veterans Day in New York City.‚Äù   Mr. Miyamura was deployed to Korea as a corporal and was called into active duty when the Korean War began in the summer of 1950. On the night of April 24-25, 1951, his unit‚Äôs position was assaulted by a vastly superior Chinese force. Although wounded and bleeding badly, Miyamura single-handedly held off the attacking force so that the rest of his men could retreat safely, before he lost consciousness and was captured by the enemy. #Godblessourvets #NMtrue #hero
